abstract: A few days after Morgan Stanley reported its first loss in its 74-year history, the bank announced late Friday afternoon that its chief executive, James P. Gorman, would receive $8.11 million in deferred stock as part of his bonus for 2009.
snippet: A few days after Morgan Stanley reported its first loss in its 74-year history, the bank announced late Friday afternoon that its chief executive, James P. Gorman, would receive $8.11 million in deferred stock as part of his bonus for 2009.
lead_paragraph: A few days after Morgan Stanley reported its first loss in its 74-year history, the bank announced late Friday afternoon that its chief executive, James P. Gorman, would receive $8.11 million in deferred stock as part of his bonus for 2009, The New York Times’s Graham Bowley reports.

headline.main: Bonus for Morgan Stanley Chief Tops $8 Million
